options.title: -a FILENUM
options.description: also print unpairable lines from file FILENUM, where FILENUM is 1 or 2, corresponding to FILE1 or FILE2

options.title: -e EMPTY
options.description: replace missing input fields with EMPTY

options.title: -i, --ignore-case
options.description: ignore differences in case when comparing fields

options.title: -i, --ignore-case
options.description: ignore differences in case when comparing fields

options.title: -o FORMAT
options.description: obey FORMAT while constructing output line

options.title: -t CHAR
options.description: use CHAR as input and output field separator

options.title: -v FILENUM
options.description: like -a FILENUM, but suppress joined output lines

options.title: -1 FIELD
options.description: join on this FIELD of file 1

options.title: -2 FIELD
options.description: join on this FIELD of file 2

options.title: --check-order
options.description: check that the input is correctly sorted, even if all input lines are pairable

options.title: --nocheck-order
options.description: do not check that the input is correctly sorted

options.title: --header
options.description: treat the first line in each file as field headers, print them without trying to pair them

options.title: -z, --zero-terminated
options.description: line delimiter is NUL, not newline

options.title: -z, --zero-terminated
options.description: line delimiter is NUL, not newline
